meanings.definition: A person who cleans or polishes something, especially metal objects.
meanings.sent1: The furbishers at the museum carefully polished the ancient armor.
meanings.sent2: The furbishers in the workshop made the metal shine like new.
meanings.sent3: The furbishers decided to have a race to see who could polish the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a furbisher, brightening up the room with its polish.
meanings.sent5: The furbishers' work left a gleaming impression on all who saw the metal objects.

meanings.definition: Tools or devices used for cleaning or polishing.
meanings.sent1: The toolbox was full of various furbishers for different surfaces.
meanings.sent2: She carefully selected the right furbisher to clean the delicate silverware.
meanings.sent3: The furbishers seemed to dance in the sunlight as they cleaned the car.
meanings.sent4: His words were like furbishers, polishing the rough edges of the argument.
meanings.sent5: The furbishers gleamed in the light, ready to make any surface sparkle.
